titleproper.value: Guide to the Herschel Silverman Collection of Theodore Enslin Correspondence <num>MSS.358</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Stacey Flatt, with arrangment by Emily King.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-06-23T15:14:45</date>

unittitle.value: Herschel Silverman Collection of Theodore Enslin Correspondence

abstract.value:
American Beat poet Herschel Silverman (1926-2015) was strongly influenced by jazz music and other Beat writers. He read and wrote poetry well into his 80s.
Poet Theodore Enslin (1925-2011) published over 80 books of poetry in his career. He lived the majority of his life in rural Maine, where he farmed and wrote until he passed away at the age of 86.
This collection contains correspondence between Herschel Silverman and Theodore Enslin during the later part of their lives, beginning in 1994 until Enslin's death in 2011. Topics include responses to each other's writings, world events, health, friends, and family. These topics illustrate the long-term friendships of this generation of writers, as they moved into old age and faced challenges both professionally and personally.

p.value: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Identification of item, date; Herschel Silverman Collection of Theodore Enslin Correspondence; MSS 358; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Herschel Silverman in October, 2012; the accession number associated with this gift is 2012.358.

This collection contains correspondence between poets/friends Herschel Silverman and Theodore Enslin, beginning in 1994 until Enslin's death in 2011. Topics include responses to each other's writings, world events, health, friends, and family. These topics illustrate the long-term friendships of this generation of writers, as they moved into old age and the challenges they faced professionally and personally.
